text: How deeply do you regret your last major life decision?
It's Friday night. What's the plan?

options.label: Tidying up my sock drawer and watching a documentary.
Dinner at that new restaurant I booked two weeks ago.
Bar-hopping until 2 AM and ordering questionable street food.
Showing up uninvited to a house party I heard about on Twitter.

text: How likely are you to tell a total stranger your darkest secret?
min_label: I have walls higher than the Alps (0)
max_label: I'm an open book on a delayed train (10)

text: What is your relationship with 'The Mute Button' during a video call?

options.label: It is my most trusted, ever-present friend.
I use it, but sometimes forget to unmute.
I've muted once. It felt aggressive.
What button? Everyone needs to hear my dog's opinions.

text: Your spice tolerance is really a metaphor for your life tolerance. Rate it.
min_label: A single sprinkle of black pepper is a journey (0)
max_label: The ghost pepper is just the appetizer (10)

text: How do you organize your photos on your phone?

options.label: By year, month, and meticulously tagged folders.
I let the phone sort them automatically.
They're a chronological mess of screenshots and blurry pet photos.
I delete 5,000 photos only when the storage error forces me.

text: How long has it been since you ate food that was maybe... past its prime?
min_label: I check the date before I breathe near it (0)
max_label: If it doesn't walk away, it's fair game (10)

text: A friend offers you a 'great investment opportunity.' You say...

options.label: No thanks, my money is in a low-risk index fund.
I'll read the prospectus and do some research first.
I'm interested, but only after two cocktails.
How many crypto coins do I need to buy to own a tiger?

text: On a scale of 0-10, how much of your current life plan is based on a horoscope or a random fortune cookie?
max_label: The cookie said 'Move West.' So I did (10)

text: What is the *most* chaotic item of clothing in your current laundry pile?

options.label: A perfectly folded sweater waiting its turn.
A sock that lost its partner months ago.
A single, suspiciously stained shirt I don't remember wearing.
A full-body banana costume, ironically, but also not ironically.

text: How often do you start a new hobby, invest heavily, and immediately quit?
min_label: I'm a loyalist; I stick it out (0)
max_label: My closet is a graveyard of unfinished projects (10)

text: Your most recent DIY project resulted in...

options.label: A beautiful, sturdy, and functional piece of furniture.
A slightly wobbly shelf, but hey, it works.
An abstract art piece that vaguely resembles a lamp.
A trip to the emergency room or a missing deposit on the rental.

text: How much of your day is spent overthinking an interaction from 7 years ago?
min_label: My memory is as fresh as a spring daisy (0)
max_label: I'm currently composing a mental apology for that one thing I said in 2018 (10)

text: When you open your email inbox, you feel...

options.label: A pleasant sense of order. Everything is sorted.
Slightly annoyed, but I tackle the unread ones immediately.
Panic. I have 3,000 unread emails, but I know where the important ones are.
A detached, morbid curiosity about the 25,000+ unread messages. It's a lifestyle.

text: The maximum number of tabs you currently have open on your web browser.
max_label: It's an unholy altar of memory usage (10)

text: When presented with a 'Wet Paint' sign, your immediate reaction is to...

options.label: Back away slowly and politely inform others of the danger.
Take a photo of the sign, because it's slightly ironic.
Lightly poke it with one finger to 'test' the wetness.
High-five it with your whole hand. You like to live dangerously.

text: How often do you talk to inanimate objects, like plants or kitchen appliances?
max_label: Daily pep talks with the toaster (10)

text: You find a mysterious, unlabeled tape cassette. What do you do?

options.label: Immediately toss it. Too much risk.
Research its history, then listen on a device I buy specifically for this.
Listen to it right now, but only through one earbud.
I start recording my own conspiracy theories over whatever was on it.

text: How likely are you to start a spontaneous, inappropriate dance party in a public space?
max_label: I'm dancing in the DMV right now (10)

text: Your spirit animal is most accurately represented by:

options.label: A very organized beaver building a sturdy dam.
A mildly stressed squirrel hiding walnuts.
A seagull aggressively stealing a french fry.
A confused possum riding a unicycle.

text: If a wizard offered you a magical item, how likely are you to choose the cursed one?
min_label: I choose the sensible, non-cursed wallet (0)
max_label: Cursed objects give my life narrative weight (10)

text: What is the primary function of your kitchen oven?

options.label: Baking perfect loaves of sourdough bread.
Heating up frozen pizzas and occasional dinners.
Storage for extra pots and pans.
It's where my cat likes to sleep when it's cold. Don't worry, it's off.

text: How accurately does your current outfit match the current weather?
max_label: It's 100 degrees and I'm wearing a snowsuit (10)

text: Your preferred method of transportation involves:

options.label: A clean, reliable, modern vehicle.
Public transit, mostly on time.
A skateboard, even for long distances.
A stolen shopping cart filled with emotional baggage.

text: Rate your ability to keep a straight face when someone is being profoundly ridiculous.
min_label: I am a rock of neutrality (0)
max_label: I am incapable of containing the giggles (10)

text: If you saw a five-dollar bill on the sidewalk, you would:

options.label: Ignore it. It might be a distraction from a scam.
Pick it up and put it in your wallet.
Pick it up and immediately buy a ridiculous scratch-off ticket.
Yell 'FINDERS KEEPERS!' and run into traffic.

text: How likely are you to befriend a neighborhood raccoon?
max_label: I'm currently teaching one to juggle (10)

text: How do you handle a sudden, loud noise?

options.label: I identify the source and remain calm.
A small jump, then I'm fine.
I emit a strange yelp and hide behind the nearest object.
I scream louder than the noise, just to assert dominance.

text: How often do you forget where you parked your car/bike/self?
max_label: I once walked home and forgot I drove (10)

text: When you encounter a 'Do Not Enter' sign, you think:

options.label: Ah, okay. I must turn around.
I wonder who decided that.
Maybe they meant 'Do Not Enter... Unless You're Me.'
I interpret this as a personal dare from the city council.
